attachments.title: UBS: Apple Reportedly Could Have Over 1,000 Engineers Working on AR in Israel
attachments.text: According to UBS analyst Steven Milunovich, Apple could have over 1,000 engineers working on Augmented Reality technology in Israel, mostly at its major R&D centre in Herzliya. Milunovich maintains Apple might introduce AR features similar to Google’s Tango in the next iPhone. AR and VR technologies are in their infancy, but well past the proof-of-concept stage, …
attachments.fallback: Road to VR: UBS: Apple Reportedly Could Have Over 1,000 Engineers Working on AR in Israel
